wikitext.*:
[[Image:Mr. Hart 9 May 1961.png|thumb]] On [[9 May]] [[1961]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien|a letter]] to Mr Hart'''.{{webcite|author=[[Wayne G. Hammond]], [[Christina Scull]]|articleurl=http://www.hammondandscull.com/addenda/chronology.html|articlename=Addenda and Corrigenda to ''The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide'' (2006) Vol. 1: Chronology|dated=|website=HS|accessed=24 January 2013}}{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.keysauctions.co.uk/enlarge.php?lid=619276|articlename=Lot 1294 in Books Day 2 30/03/2012|dated=|website=[http://www.keysauctions.co.uk/ KeysAuctions.co.uk]|accessed=24 March 2012}} *'''Subject:''' Tolkien intends to visit [[Cambridge]]. *'''Publication:''' None. *'''Description:''' Typed letter, one page. Signed. ==Transcription== {{blockquote|Dear Mr. Hart,

I find myself unexpectedly able to come to Cambridge this Saturday. I am being driven over by the Warden of Merton, who will be going back on the Sunday, but I shall not myself be obliged to return until some time on Monday. As far as I can see I shall be unoccupied on Sunday. It is very short notice but I wondered if this might be of any interest to you. I have written to Mr. Dufton in the same terms.

Yours sincerely,

J.R.R. Tolkien}} {{references}} [[Category:Letters|Hart, Mr]]
